name: Janis Joplin
associatedActs: Big Brother and the Holding Company; Kozmic Blues Band; Full Tilt Boogie Band; Grateful Dead; Kris Kristofferson
description: Janis Lyn Joplin (January 19, 1943 - October 4, 1970) was an American rock singer and songwriter; one of the most successful and widely-known female rock stars of her era. After releasing three albums, she died of a heroin overdose at the age of 27. A fourth album, Pearl, was released in January 1971, just over three months after her death. It reached number one on the Billboard charts.

name: Jimi Hendrix
associatedActs: The Jimi Hendrix Experience; Curtis Knight and the Squires; Jimmy James and the Blue Flames; Band of Gypsies
description: James Marshall 'Jimi' Hendrix (born Johnny Allen Hendrix; November 27
column11: and songwriter. Although his mainstream career spanned only four years
column12: he is widely regarded as one of the most influential electric guitarists in the history of popular music
column13: and one of the most celebrated musicians of the 20th century. The Rock and Roll Hall of Fame describes him as 'arguably the greatest instrumentalist in the history of rock music'.
